snippet: An aide to Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey texted a colleague that he lied when he told reporters that his senior staff did not know about a plot to close traffic lanes, according to a court filing....
abstract: Text messages sent in 2013 by New Jersey Gov Chris Christie's former aide Christina Genovese Renna accuse Christie of lying when he said he did not believe any senior member of his staff knew about plot to block traffic to George Washington Bridge; text exchange is first piece of evidence that suggests Christie knew more about scheme than he admitted.
lead_paragraph: An aide to Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey texted a colleague that he lied when he told reporters that his senior staff did not know about a plot to close traffic lanes, according to a court filing.

headline.main: Christie ‘Flat Out Lied’ in George Washington Bridge Case, Aide Said
headline.print_headline: Christie ‘Flat Out Lied’ in George Washington Bridge Case, Aide Said

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
